string-array.item: Emma, \nYou have grown so much these past 20 years...
I still remember that little blond girl with wavy curls, leaping and bounding over furniture, scaring your parents half to death.
You may be able to fool others, but I know you are in agony.
You used to have so much fun your joy would eminate from your smile and flow from your laughter.
Know this in your agony, you were once happy.
Having your parents taken, living destitute, in exile, not knowing who you really are..
not knowning justice or mercy in your years.
Storms can\'t be taimed, but they can be ridden out.
This letter can do little to ease your misery.
Know this though, that your family\'s tools lie in the hands of the man who took your father from you.
Whatever justice you might know in this life, will likely come from your own hands.
You\'re family\'s tools are a start...
They are held in the kingdom of Mechanant.
Seek out a man named Kody
Sorry I can\'t offer you anything more...
